alert.note: Alert for Adams; Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 28 at 6:07PM MDT until May 28 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Washington County in northeastern Colorado... East central Adams County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 606 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles east of Shamrock, or 26 miles south of Fort Morgan, moving northeast at 20 mph. Another severe thunderstorm was located about 8 miles east of Leader, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Washington and east central Adams Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
